Description: Body sherd of North Ionian pottery plate; exterior reserved, with set of four or more grooves; interior: buff slip; palmettes alternately reversed, leaves with added red; to the centre a broad band of with added red band lined in white.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Compare British Museum GR 1888.6-1.544c (with similar although not identical decoration). The pattern (palmettes alternately reversed) is not common in the East Greek world.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. 4, 22)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.805)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
